channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Afghanistan says it has killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations
item.description: Afghanistan said Sunday it killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, in response to what it called repeated violations of its territory and airspace.
item.content:encoded:
Afghanistan said Sunday it killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, in response to what it called repeated violations of its territory and airspace.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: China vows to stand firm against Trump's 100% tariff threat
item.description: China signaled Sunday that it would not back down in the face of a 100% tariff threat from President Donald Trump, urging the U.S. to resolve differences through negotiations instead of threats.
item.content:encoded:
China signaled Sunday that it would not back down in the face of a 100% tariff threat from President Donald Trump, urging the U.S. to resolve differences through negotiations instead of threats.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 5 things to know about the health care fight behind the shutdown
item.description: If Congress doesn't act, costs will rise on premiums for health care plans on the Affordable Care Act marketplaces. Here's what to know about the politics and real-world impact of this issue.
item.content:encoded:
If Congress doesn't act, costs will rise on premiums for health care plans on the Affordable Care Act marketplaces. Here's what to know about the politics and real-world impact of this issue.

(Image credit: Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Preparations begin to ramp up aid in Gaza as ceasefire brings hope for end to 2-year war
item.description: Preparations were also underway Sunday for the release of Israeli hostages held in Gaza and Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.
item.content:encoded:
Preparations were also underway Sunday for the release of Israeli hostages held in Gaza and Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.

(Image credit: Mohammed Arafat)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Hollywood's quirky leading lady, Diane Keaton, dies aged 79
item.description: Diane Keaton, who remained one of Hollywood's quirkiest and most beloved actors decades after her Academy Award-winning performance in the movie Annie Hall, has died aged 79.
item.content:encoded:
Diane Keaton, who remained one of Hollywood's quirkiest and most beloved actors decades after her Academy Award-winning performance in the movie Annie Hall, has died aged 79.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: 16 people died in a blast at a Tennessee explosives factory early Friday, sheriff says
item.description: A blast in rural Tennessee that leveled an explosives plant and was felt for miles around killed 16 people and left no survivors, authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
A blast in rural Tennessee that leveled an explosives plant and was felt for miles around killed 16 people and left no survivors, authorities said.

(Image credit: Obed Lamy)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning star of 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather,' dies at 79
item.description: The actor, known for her quirky, vibrant manner and depth was 79. Across her decades-long career, she worked with prominent filmmakers including Francis Ford Coppola, Woody Allen and Nancy Meyers.
item.content:encoded:
The actor, known for her quirky, vibrant manner and depth was 79. Across her decades-long career, she worked with prominent filmmakers including Francis Ford Coppola, Woody Allen and Nancy Meyers.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello/Invision)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump slashes mental health agency as shutdown drags on
item.description: Sources tell NPR that more than 100 employees have been laid off at the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Agency. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention had some cuts reversed late Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
Sources tell NPR that more than 100 employees have been laid off at the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Agency. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention had some cuts reversed late Saturday.

(Image credit: Smith Collection)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Nobel Prize winner Machado says Venezuela is in 'chaos' under current regime
item.description: The far-right leader of Venezuela's opposition party said that the current president is illegitimate and called for his removal.
item.content:encoded:
The far-right leader of Venezuela's opposition party said that the current president is illegitimate and called for his removal.

(Image credit: Alfredo Lasry R)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to use 'available funds' to pay military during shutdown
item.description: President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram
